title: Prepare the PCB
description: Unpack the PCB and inspect for any damage. Test all switch sockets with a multimeter to ensure proper connectivity.
notes: Handle the PCB carefully to avoid static damage

title: Install Stabilizers
description: Insert the stabilizers into the designated slots on the PCB. Ensure they click into place securely and test the movement.
notes: Apply light lubrication to stabilizer wires for smoother operation

title: Test Switch Sockets
description: Insert a few switches into different positions to test the hot-swap sockets. Remove them after testing.
notes: Don't force switches if they don't fit easily

title: Install Case Foam
description: Place the case foam in the bottom of the keyboard case, ensuring it fits snugly without overlapping the screw holes.
notes: Trim foam carefully if it doesn't fit perfectly

title: Mount PCB in Case
description: Carefully place the PCB into the case, aligning the USB connector with the case opening. Secure with provided screws.
notes: Don't overtighten screws to avoid PCB damage

title: Install All Switches
description: Insert all mechanical switches into their designated positions. Press firmly until they click into place.
notes: Ensure all switch pins are straight before insertion

title: Install Keycaps
description: Place keycaps on all switches according to the layout diagram. Start with larger keys (spacebar, shift) then work on smaller keys.
notes: Press keycaps straight down to avoid switch damage

title: Final Testing and Setup
description: Connect the keyboard to your computer and test all keys. Configure any custom layouts or macros as desired.
notes: Use online key testers to verify all keys work properly
